reviews.review_msg: Awesome Professor! She is honest, kind, and wants her students to do the best in her class!

Best prof ever! Super nice, caring and fun. Everything was straightforward and clear, everything you learn is applicable and you can see using. Attendance was not mandatory, but definitely helped and would suggest going - plus she is always throwing fun facts and wants you to succeed. Would 100% take another class with her.
Love this prof

Wonderful teacher! You will love learning French as she makes the lessons fun and easy. Her lectures are engaging and questions are encouraged. The feedback you receive in tests and assignments are useful so you'll always know what you did wrong.
Best teacher
Best professor I have ever had! Marybelle is very responsible and caring for every student.  She makes the language class more interesting and the lecture was well organized.

Marybelle is an excellent prof. She made learning French very easy. Her classes are very interactive, exciting and fun. She is; accessible outside class, encourages students to approach her for any problems, and provides them with valuable feedback and solutions. I would highly recommend anyone planning to enrol in FREN120 to take her as your prof.
Marybelle is a nice instructor. Even though she's new to teaching, she is full of passion and making the class very interesting. Take her class!

Marybelle makes learning French feel attainable. She's very approachable and encouraging, answers your questions when she can, and provides good feedback on your progress. This was my best class this semester.

-the best lecturer at SFU 
-easy grader
-fun lecture 
-willing to help 
-study all the vocab and you will be fine

The best prof! Super nice and accessible out of class. Really wants you to succeed and is so incredibly helpful. I took beginners French as an elective and was initially scared but she really helped me to really enjoy it

Languages are hard, Jenny is so nice and helpful but you really need to attend class because falling behind is super easy! The class is mostly quizzes, tests and pop quizzes. As I said if you keep up with everything and stay organized it can be an easy good grade! Oh, there is also weekly participation online that you have to remember to do!

Senem is by far the most caring instructor I've ever had. She really wants everyone to pass with great grades, as well as truly learn French. Went into this class expecting a bore and came out entertained and supported by Senem. She'll stay late to help you with work and her tests are really easy because she'd rather we actually learn the language.
If you are interested in French, you should take fren120 with Senem. She is one of the best instructors I have ever met at SFU. She is there for you and will help you to succeed the course.
What I wanna say is she is awesome, helpful, and nice-being
She is a very good teacher. If you attend classes and do your homework you will ace the course easily.

I took Fren 120 with Senem last Fall. I would say that she was the best prof for me so far. It was an introductory french course, so if you put the effort to learn the new things (new vocabulary), you will definitely learn amazing things and fall in love in french. She is super clear, very helpful and always makes engages with the students.
Senem was such an amazing professor. She always helps, provides extra material and really wants you to learn. The class is very easy and fun, enjoyed it a lot!
He's the best TA in the world! So funny and intriguing! He's teaching 121 at 8:30am next semester for anyone interested!
Very helpful TA and a very nice guy, we always get bonbons as rewards. Thoughtful and he cares about his students a lot. If I'm taking FREN 121 I would like to take the class with this teacher.
he is a very good TA?good teaching skills ? funny?helpful. He always give some candies as rewards. Anyways, if u are going to take French course, just look for this guy.
Super nice and very helpful TA.

HE IS AMAZING INSTRUCTOR. He is funny, engaging, and very helpful. Fast response on his email, very kind and helpful on his lecture time as well as office hour. YOU MUST go to his lecture since he provides the best lecture ever.
Etienne is the most helpful, and funny instructor I have ever met. If you go to his lecture, you will find it extremely for your tests. THE BEST INSTRUCTOR IN SFU.
He is best TA ever!! Attend every his class and consider what he say, you will definately get a good mark! Tres bien!;)
He's a very good TA: interesting, engaging and funny.
Really awesome teacher, always kept things fun and interesting. Would highly recommend him!
He's the best TA everrrr! :) super nice, funny, and easy to talk to.
Very nice teacher, and very helpful to students. Clearly passionate about French and willing to help students learn in the best way that they can.
I don't like french but he's very good teacher.
My favorite teacher this semester for sure!
the best teacher I've ever met!
He's kinda cute when he speaks french;)

Hey enjoys teaching the course and he's very approachable! Its not an easy class but if you show up to every class and do weekly review you should be fine. Even though its a language course and some people find it intimidating to speak up during class, he makes you feel comfortable and uses different kinds of activities and techniques that can help
highly recommended , very nice, helpful and explains the subject very well! . the only downside is the grading in this course, NOT his problem though :)
He is super super helpful, fun and funny. You should definitely choose him!!!
he is very sweeeeet & really helpful :) he LOVEs his students
Super nice guy!
Awesome!
He is the nicest prof I've ever seen.
Very nice TA, always willing to help the class. Highly recommend him to anyone taking this class.
he is veryyyyy nice and helpful
very nice teacher, really helpful.
Super nice person. Always willing to help. Extremely enthusiastic about teaching.
Awesome professor! I have never taken french and it is going absolutely fabulous. The professor is always there for you to practice your pronunciation or give additional feedback on any matter!

I think this course was going to be easy but it was really hard not due to the material covered but because we had to take too many tests, including oral tests and there was a lot of homework due every Sunday night. Each test was subdivided into three parts and there were five tests meaning 15 tests in total.

She was great, however, people who have never done French before will likely struggle in this class. There was not enough emphasis on attempting to converse until the final oral examination. Also, she does everything once only so if you miss that, you're on your own. She's very helpful though and was very kind!

Livia is simply amazing. She explains course content extremely well and answers questions clearly. Honestly, I look forward to going to class because of her! She's a very lovely prof (inside and out:)) and I wish there were more like her in universities. Definitely take her if you can. You go, Livia!

Such a nice and beautiful instructor, although her excellent teaching style is more attractive! Shes a great teacher with patience and respect to students from any level of French, which means everyone get fully encouraged and inspired. Tests, quizzes, and homework are just right, she provides lots of chances for us to practice and follow up.

I highly recommend her class. The way she teaches is easy to understand and she always try to make the class interesting. If you follow what she said in the lecture and review what you learn adequately, you can easily get A in this course. Even outside of the class, she can help you study a lot. I've never met such a wonderful teacher like her!
